description: Never a disappointment!  Pastries are to die for!  Pies are delicious and today I had a chili dog!  You heard that right!  OMG so creative.  Eleana keep up the fun and don't just walk by this place!  Stop in for a great cup o joe and a slice of pie and you have gone to heaven!
author: Jill P.

description:
Cute place! Was attracted bc (1) the sign outside said "cheapest hipster coffee in the city" and (2) they make their goods in-house

Got the dark chocolate hazelnut ring on a thin shortbread(?) cookie. I loved how the hazelnuts were kept whole, though I wish the layer of dark chocolate was thicker and the cookie part didn't do anything for me. I like the dark chocolate bar with whole hazelnuts from trader joes better.

Regardless, I would come back to try their other things if I was in the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way for this after my experience
author: Jeanie N.

description:
What a great find in the Fillmore area. Came here with the bf on a trip exploring SF. 

Yum I got the peach tart and a chocolate chip cookie and the bf got the almond croissant and the meringue cookie. All were delicious. I love the tart. I do not know what the bottom filling on the tart was but it was amazing. So flavorful and creamy perfect to go with the sweetness of the peaches. 

They had a lot of options to chose from their expansive display counter of both sweet and savory treats. Kind of a small space but it's okay. Definitely will go back. My bf and I already decided before finishing our treats.
author: Denice D.

description:
I lived less than a block from this place for over a year before I stopped by, and I can't believe what I've been missing out on this whole time! The pies cooling in the window (literally) finally lured me in.
 
This place has great coffee, an impressive pastry display, and very friendly staff. Everything is always fresh and very reasonably priced compared to other bakeries in the area. They also have a pretty good selection of gluten-free treats (think almond-based marzipan cookies, macaroons etc) for those that require them. Adding gluten-free pastries (like croissants) to the menu would be great to see. Definitely want to get a custom cake or pie for a future birthday as those look amazing too.
 
Glad to have found a great place in the neighborhood for sweet treats of all varieties!
author: Kathryn P.

description:
With Jane, B. Patisserie, Arsicault, and Mr. Holmes around it's easy to overlook this little bakeshop.  We pass it all the time and occasionally would go in and grab something for our sweet tooth like a cookie or danish.  I never noticed their cakes and petit four until our recent stop. 

They make so many types of sweets I wonder if they're baking all day.  They have pies, cakes, pastries, cookies, and everything in between.  This time we decided on a slice of cake and something new.  Both were surprisingly delicious!  

We almost got the princess cake but decided on something new so we ordered the Chocolate-Salted Caramel Mouse Cake.  Two layers of mouse, salted caramel on the top and chocolate at the bottom with soft moist cake layers in between, then it's covered with more chocolate.  It's so good I wish we ordered two.  I love the salted caramel chocolate mouse combo.  

We also ordered the Hazelnut Ring.  It's hazelnut butter cookie, hazelnut cream, hazelnuts and dark chocolate.  If you love hazelnuts this cookie is for you.  

Will definitely stop by more often and maybe try their cute little petit four.
Service is hit or miss.
author: Naty D.

description:
I've walked by this little bake shop on Fillmore a million times but for some reason never bothered to come in and try anything. (And I love pastries!!) 

Today I was a little early for a haircut next door and so popped my nose in and was shocked at what amazing things this little store was hiding inside. Slices of beautiful Swedish princess cake (whole ones too), clearly perfectly laminated golden fluffy butter croissants, candied orange and apricots dipped in chocolate, cherry pie filled to the brim with dark red cherries... I could go on and on. Oh, did I mention they also have kouign amann and coconut macaroons?? 

I grabbed a piece of too many things to list, and I have to say the Swedish princess cake is perfectly made. The cream and custard are light and discernible, and the Genoese sponge is fluffy beyond belief. Perfect, perfect layers! The only fault I could find with it was slightly too little jam and a the marzipan a little too stiff, but seriously, this is significantly better than Schubert's!  

I love this little place so dearly--everything is simple, but perfectly made.
author: Su Lin Y.

description:
It's time to update my review for this bakery, though I regret I must downgrade it slightly. I've been here frequently over the past few years, and I think the quality of their baked goods is still great. I tend to go for their simpler items like cookies, pie slices, or smaller sweets like a chocolate-covered marzipan, and I usually leave with my sweet tooth satisfied. 

However, I noticed that service can sometimes be mixed. When the bakery gets busy, it seems like some employees get frazzled, which makes them less polite toward customers. I was never significantly bothered by this fact until today, when I wanted to confirm a type of cookie on display. It visibly looked like it was made with gingerbread but the sign said it was a sugar cookie. When I confirmed with the employee that the sign was incorrect and suggested changing the signs to avoid future confusion, her stare was eviscerating and her response was curt. Did this stop me from getting a snack? No, but I have a feeling I won't be back anytime soon.
author: Keith H.

description: I stumbled across this place while walking around San Francisco and was so glad I went inside. I grabbed 4 petit fours -- lemon curd, raspberry rose, strawberry cream, and s'mores. They were all amazing and were decorated so well, and the raspberry rose was SO FANTASTIC that I nearly turned right around to go get some more. This will be a go-to place for me if I'm ever in the area again.
author: Tayler K.

description:
I had the blueberry cream cheese danish and a vanilla latte. If this is all they served here - I'd still rate it 5 stars. Everything looked too good to eat and it took me a few minutes to make a decision.
They have a really good coffee & espresso menu - all drinks incredibly well made.
author: Anisa A.

description:
I moved to Pac Heights a few months ago and Fillmore Bakeshop has very quickly become my go-to morning stroll destination.  Why?  

Variety:  this lovely bakery provides an incredible offering of goodies everyday.  Choose from sweet, savory, soft, and crunchy.  Their baked goods portfolio is sure to please everyone

Creativity:  each day is a new adventure!  Fillmore Bakeshop offers a delightful menagerie of goodies and the items to choose from are always different!  I personally appreciate this because it's possible to visit two days in a row and have a completely different selection 

Consistency:  high quality ingredients produce high quality items here.  Also, you can taste the freshness of these day-of baked delights.  You can throw a dart or point to an item blindfolded.  Why?  Because EVERYTHING they offer is awesome!

The prices here are not cheap, but I believe they are fair for Fillmore Street.  My love for Fillmore Bakeshop is true, and I can't wait to bring my out of town foodie guests here!
author: Andrea H.

description: The princess cake is the best I've had by far. The coffee is also solid and a very good price.
author: Jo B.

description:
I have passed by this location so many times and never noticed that a delightful bakery was inside. Thank you Yelp for finding it for me.

I needed to bring booze and dessert to a New Years dinner ( no judging please!!!)  I checked out Fillmore bake shop first and was really impressed with their quality, technique, and inventiveness.

The chocolate and salted caramel cake is a show stopper: with its lovely ribbons of shaved dark chocolate  ganache on top it is really something to behold.

But wait not only does this beauty look amazing it tastes absolutely divine. Light fluffy cake interspersed with layers of light creamy chocolate mouse and salted caramel.  

I brought home a piece of princess cake for the baker in the family and they just raved about it. 

I would come back and definitely try the s'mores bites, the princess cake, ebony and ivory, St. honore cake....god I'm getting hungry just thinking about it.

Check them out grab a cup of their hipster coffee and  a pastry or slice of cake and enjoy!!!
author: David G.

description:
A talent of ours dropped off some treats at our office from Fillmore Bakeshop. I came back to a surprise on my desk on Tuesday, December 20th around 1:15pm.

First off, their presentation is really nice. From the look of the box to the confections, everything was really pretty. I got what I guess you could call Petit Fours. There were two different kinds. Six each, both chocolate. I didn't try either as I'm not really a chocolate fan, but a coworker tried them and liked them.

I'd love to try their version of a cronut and their macarons. Those are more up my alley. One day!
author: Elena N.

description:
Thank you Fillmore Bakeshop, Elena! 
Carmen's birthday cake was amazing! We love the surprises, colors and decorations!! And the chocolate mousse was addicting as well. You are awesome!!
author: Millie K.

description: I think this bakery may make the best carrot cake I ever had and I'm not even a fan of carrot cake.  We got a cake for Easter and we basically got it for the design but once all of us tasted it we couldn't stop eating it and gobbled it up!!! That good!!!!  I can't wait to try other cakes and baked goods from here!!!
author: RD R.

description:
The napolean cake from the Fillmore bakeshop is delicious! The perfect combination of cream filling on the inside, flaky crust on the top. There is a top layer with something really sweet, but it allows your guests to adjust the sweetness to their own preference. 

I was told the St Honore cake was delicious so will definitely be visiting to pick one up in the future!
author: Claire W.

description: Thank you so much for this wonderful delight that you brought to our family, the mango layers are delicious definitely coming back for another!!!! Strongly recommend!!!!
author: Jun L.

description:
I la-la-love Swedish (also known as Princess) cake. I was so excited to try a piece at the Fillmore bake shop. 

Service was pleasant and kind.

Lets talk about these velvety layers. The thin layer of raspberry really rounds out the flavor well. Wonderful burst of almond flavor. The marzipan is a bit thick and heavy. Maybe a bit too sweet. It would be phenomenal if it were a little softer/thinner too.

I'd eat it again, but I'd get it more often if the recipe was improved slightly.

Great value for a nice thick slice.
author: Leica G.

description: Fillmore bake shop is tucked on a corner between Sutter and Bush. Their selections are a bit ordinary compared to other bakeries in town. I was drawn to their petit fours given how cute the decorations were. However for $2.50 each it didn't taste up to the price tag. The honey lavender had a subtle lavender flavor. The hazelnut chocolate was sort of hollow on the inside. Overall they tasted cheap and was worth 75 cents at most. I suppose you're paying for their rental space since this is the Fillmore after all...
author: Virginia Y.

description: Their Pretzel croissant is unlike anything I've ever had... IT doesn't even taste like pretzels more like an everything bagel meets a croissant and it's AMAZING !
author: Adam B.

description:
This review is based on the wonderful service and slice of apricot pie which was lovely (if a tad too sweet). Their cookies and pastries are beautiful and I love the variety! Of course I bought $20 worth of cookies for a party and proceeded to FORGET THEM ON MY TABLE AS I LEFT :( 

I hope that the cookies were at least eaten by staff or given to someone in need. It was raining pretty heavily earlier today and this cute little coffee shop provided much needed respite. Will definitely be back!
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Great French roast coffee at a good price in the Fillmore? I found it.

The bakeshop has a wide selection of pastries ( like morning buns, scones, and croissants) and even dipped chocolates along with 3 or so tables overlooking Fillmore.  

Super yummy bear claw :)

It's a nice bakery cafe to get away from the bustle which is all around you. The owner started the famous Woodside Bakery and taught pastry and candy making for years. 

Give it a try - especially if you love dark roast drip coffee!
author: Susie W.

description:
I had the Fillmore Bakeshop bookmarked for such a long time - I was so excited to finally try it when I came down to the Bay. I came on a cold, foggy Friday morning. There was a steady flow of customers but nothing overwhelming. The staff were super friendly and greeted me right away. There were so many amazing looking treats and pastries to chose from (their cakes looked so beautiful too). 

I decided to get myself a slice of Princess Cake and a cup of coffee to sit and enjoy at the Bakeshop as well as get a box of goodies to-go to share with my friends. The Princess Cake was light and refreshing - the cake was moist, the fruit purée was sweet and delicious. It was wonderful. Their coffee was strong and good too (not bad quality). 

I took the box of treats to my friends and they devoured them. I got a couple macaroons, a blondie bar, and some cookies. All of them were fresh and balanced levels of sweetness. So if you're lucky enough to live near Fillmore Bakeshop or lucky enough to visit SF, be sure to stop by and treat yourself!
author: Courtney P.

description: This place is as mediocre as it gets. Came on a Sunday afternoon and the selection was lame. Service was bad, which is shocking considering all they have to do is ring your order and hand you the pastry, but somehow they manage to make that 5-minute interaction unpleasant. Just the typical bad attitude you find in the service industry in SF. I had a ham and cheese croissant that was just not good, even the Costco croissant is better. They didn't offer to warm it up. I've had much better service at Starbucks.
author: Raquel G.

description: I've ordered three large cakes over the course of one year and each time my experience has been perfect. The cakes are fresh, beautiful and prepared right on time. My go-to bakery!
author: Kaydie H.

description: Fantastic father & daughter local bake shop. I knew Chef Doug during our time at the California Culinary Academy. He is an attention to detail guy and you can easily tell with the quality of the cookies, pastries & cake here. The prices are more than fair for the baked goods & they serve great coffee too.
author: Al G.

description: We live in the neighborhood and love this place so much that we come here to get pastries (usually their scone and a danish w/ coffee + OJ) almost every weekend-it's that good. That's saying a lot when Jane is up the street, B Patisserie is a few blocks away, and Mr. Holmes is about 15 minutes away, by foot. Their scones (any of the fruit ones) are the best! My husband loves their peach custard danish, the quiche is yummy, and their coffee isn't bad either. Local, cozy, charming spot where there isn't a long line, and the pastries beat any of those in the area. A forever Fillmore Bakeshop fan.
author: Katherine W.

description:
I am not a morning person, so of course they were sold out of cronuts by the time I got here. Oh well, I've never been drawn to the idea of cronuts, or hybrid foods. But I was drawn to the painted windows. The inside gave off a neighborhood diner feel.
We shared a slice of apricot pie and a hot cross bun. I don't think I'm much of a pie person. As usual, my favorite part of the pie was the crust. The filling was too sweet, and oddly enough, had some bitter notes to it too. The hot cross bun just tasted like one of those coconut buns from Chinese bakeries, but in square form.
Both were decent, but didn't really awaken my taste buds. Maybe I didn't order their best items, but the macarons looked a little dense to me, and I wasn't in the mood for a croissant.
author: Joy W.

description:
So freaking delicious... I absolutely love how fresh and delicious all of the pastries are! You can see the bakers in the back making all of the delicious goodies and bringing them real-time to the counter to sell. I've been here a couple of times over the past few weeks, and every single item that I've ordered has been spectacular.

CRONUT: super crispy, flaky, and not too sweet. The cinnamon sugar on the outside added the perfect amount of sweetness without it being overwhelming. I loved the texture of the cronut and would love to see a variety of flavors!! I would die.

VEGGIE CROISSANT: there is always a wide variety of croissants, and this veggie one with cheese, mushroom, and spinach really caught my eye. I got it to go, but the croissant was lightly toasted before it was given to me, so it was deliciously warm while I was eating it. The filling was not too light and not too heavy, and the light and fluffy croissant exterior was the perfect binding of the pastry.

APPLE BREAD PUDDING: this was AMAZING. I will come here just for the bread pudding from now on. The last time I went, they did not make bread pudding, and I was so upset!! The custard that binds the bread pieces together along with the freshly baked cinnamon apple slices married together so well in my mouth. I cannot wait to have another serving of Fillmore Bakeshop bread pudding.

Overall, this is such a cute mom-and-pop bakeshop on Fillmore street, and I highly recommend stopping by to grab a pastry. The decor is always super cute, and all of the pastries seem like they would be absolutely amazing. Good luck picking which one you want to eat!
author: Sheila D.

description:
This area is one my fav place to hangout if you want to be away from the touristy crowd. I like close proximity to Japan town (little touristy but every trip ends up with a new find) the only thing lacking is a good cafe. The other spot nearby fills void nicely. This could have been a nice addition but sadly no
Coffee cake is OK
Cappuccino is forgettable. Little crema and a very mellow taste. No latte art. Milk frothed poorly.
Cup that it is served is very odd to drink from as it has edges facing inwards (more like a soup bowl). 
2 stars
author: Elvis A.

description: Loved it here and will definitely be back! This cute little bake shop has an incredible smell of freshly baked desserts. The employees are very friendly and accommodating, the coffee, and most importantly, the DESSERT was mouthwatering!
author: Maryna C.

description: Delicious croissant with ham and cheese. The chai was different spices but it was great. Nice shop. I wanted to buy more desserts and cookies but it was early in the morning.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
A friend brought us the most amazing fruit tart. All of the fruit was beautiful and fresh, the glaze wasn't overly sweet, and the colors were gorgeous. 

The texture of the crust itself was great, and I love marzipan, so the light layer of raspberry jam and generous marzipan were great. I would have been happy eating just this part.  There was also a light custard holding the fruit to the bottom. 

I would definitely come back for this fruit tart - it's great to bring to a party.
author: Marilyn T.

description: I walked from Sweet Maple and tried a couple of their cookies. Buttery and sweet just like I like it. The bakery its self is small and cute. Their croissant were mostly sold out so I assume they are delish. They have plenty people working there so service was fast and good.
author: Marina P.

description: Just an all around good place. Got a cheap and simple vanilla latte and a sugar cookie bar. Both were excellent and not expensive. Place was cute and line wasn't out the door like a lot of these trendy mediocre bakeries. Def would recommend!!
author: Cara N.

description:
I really like this bakery. FYI, they make "CRONUTS". If this bakery was closer to me, I would be waking up earlier on the weekends to get their cronut. Once in a while, they do make special flavors. Their cronut are really good. Not as oil as a donut and flakier than a croissant. YUM! They start selling them around 9am and they sell out pretty early. There was once I made sure I was first to get the cronuts on a Friday morning. 

I was just here again around 1pm and many of their pastries were sold out and of course no more cronut. I saw that they had one more "HOT CROSS BUN" left. Never had it, therefore I brought the last one. It's bread with some type of candy inside. A little dry for me. Wasn't a big fan. I did also enjoy their nonfat lattee. Super cute mug they serve it with. The staff was super friendly. 

I did order a slide of **PRINCESS CAKE to go. I think its the best princess cake I ever had. Not too sweet. So soft and moist. It's Delicious!!
author: Sandy B.

description: This review is for the cashier that I encountered today. Dessert was good but the cashier had such a shitty attitude. I walked in with my dog in my bag and he asked if it was a service dog (no hi or hello or a smile)... I told him no and asked if would it be okay if can grab something quickly and leave. He rolled his eyes and said fine! Gave me my items and had a pissy look on his face. Look, if you're worried about sanitary issues then don't handle my money and use the same bare hands and grab my pastry afterwards! Just saying. There's so many other places in that neighborhood where I can grab a dessert or pastry from for less the fraction of its cost! Never coming back here again.
author: Linda Q.

description:
I love supporting local stores, so when I walked past this on a stroll through my new neighborhood, I had to stop by! It's got a great assortment of delicious bakery bites, from macaroons to croissants and scrumptious bars. The cake display was missing so I didn't get my usual eyeful of delicious batter creations. 

I ended up getting a s'mores bar, great option for a quick dessert by the way. I will definitely come back to this location for goodies!
author: Nancy W.

description:
One word, Awesome. The people that work at Fillmore bake shop are amazing. Pastries and cakes even better. I have nothing negative to say.  Try it and you'll love it. The end. 


And who cares if they don't have cronuts. They stopped making Walkmans and I didn't hear a lot of people complaining. If you want a "cronut" buy a croissant, walk down the street, buy a doughnut, and eat them at the same time.
author: Griffin C.

description:
While I cannot speak for all of the baked good here at Fillmore Bakeshop, but the things that I have tried have been really great. The best thing I've ever had here is the danishes. Specifically the Blueberry Cream Cheese Danish is da bomb. Somehow they manage to get the dough perfectly crunchy and decadent.

I've tried the the coffee options here as well: house brew, lattes, and cappuccinos. I still prefer my usual starbucks, but if I'm sitting down for a pastry anyway, I would enjoy a cup. 

They don't have a lot of room to sit down, a couple of two person tables, but if you wanna grab and go, you should have no problem. They are usually pretty quick with the counter service.

Yes, they are pretty expensive, but you can tell that everything is fresh and made in the shop. Definitely quality food.
author: Revati V.

description:
The staff at Fillmore Bakeshop are so friendly, helpful, and nice! 
The selection is amazing- there are too many beautiful pastries to choose from. Macaroons, a variety of danishes, cookies, etc. you will definitely find something (or 5 things) that you love. 

The blueberry cream cheese danish was perfect. I can't wait to go back, and next time I'll probably buy some plum jam that is made from the owner's backyard plums. 

Love this adorable little bakery.
author: Leeyen R.

description: Cookies didn't taste very fresh. Even my 2 year old didn't like them, and he loves cookies.
author: Meredith G.

description: We have had all the different types of pastries and cakes from Fillmore Bakeshop.. and I can tell you that I have never had anything bad from there. So when it came down for choosing a place to order our wedding cake from.. it was only obvious to choose Fillmore Bakeshop! Elena and her team did an awesome job creating our dream cake. We loved our 3-tiered cake and loved every detail from the ombré colored flowers, to the overall look including our Star Wars themed cake topper and to the very delicious flavor of the Princess Cake..a definite must try at their shop.  Thank u again Elena and your crew!  Everyone loved the look and taste of the cake!
author: Lara V.

description:
The bakeshop has always been a favorite of mines.  I recall getting up early on a Sunday morning and driving 45 minutes to get in line for their cronuts.  

Even though they no longer offer cronuts, you won't go wrong with anything else they offer.  Their meringue is delicious, and their chocolate inspired creations "hit the spot".  And, not matter the time of day, you can always find something to satisfy your cravings!

RIP to the Frank the Fryer!
author: Gene D.

description: Very cute bake shop with a great selection of treats! My favorite so far has been the smores bar and the peanut butter cookies. I've also tried the chocolate croissant - good, but would recommend the other bars and cookies over it. There's also a good number of small tables and chairs inside. Will definitely be coming back!
author: Seema B.

description: I came here on a Sunday morning to try their famous cronuts. There were some seats inside which filled up quickly around 10am. There is only one flavor for the cronut, but it tasted very amazing, just like what I imagined a cronut should taste like! My friend had the cronut and a princess cake slice which had an almond flavor with some kind of fruit jam-like layer. I had a bite and liked it as well. They also sell the princess cake whole. This place would be great to order for a birthday or other special occasion. Everything in the displays looked great, and opens early. I'd definitely come back again for more cronut and try the croissants.
author: Alice S.

description:
Bring back the cronut!!

I randomly found this place a couple years ago and tried their cronut. I was so pleasantly surprised!! It was delicious!! I had never tried the famous Dominique Ansel's cronut in NYC, but I imagined that this was comparable. It was so light and fluffy. Not too oily and just delicious! I could peel off each layer. Each layer was moist and yummy.

I walked in yesterday after having tried Dominique Ansel's cronut in NYC over the weekend to compare the two... But I was sadly informed that they no longer make cronuts :(. I WAS SO SAD.... 

I tried a few of their other pastries in the past and I remember thinking they were all right. Nothing special.

I will continue making my rounds at B Patisserie (BEST KOUIGN AMANNS YOU WILL EVER HAVE).
author: Janice H.

description: Generally pretty good stuff but doesn't blow me away. I usually go for the princess cake which is good (but I think I prefer the princess cake at Schuberts).
author: Grace D.

description: Delicious morsels of goodness in every last bite . Blueberry pie is by far my favorite selection.
author: MoyMoy K.

description: Disclaimer - haven't tried anything here. (in SF for the day and didn't want to ruin my brunch plans). The guy who makes the jams/jellies (the owner? head baker?) is super friendly and fun to chat with.  Ended up buying some of his jam and gave it to my Lyft driver.
author: Linda N.

description: Lovely neighborhood bakeshop and locals' favorite. I have been going there literally every day for their tasty fresh almond croissant and most affordable hipster coffee in town (less than $2 for large), still loving it.
author: Grant G.

description: Love the princess cake here. The marzipan is thick, but that's how I like it. The custard is nice and creamy as well, filled with vanilla beans. Given that, the cake is not as dense as I would like it to be and prices are a bit steep at $4.25 for a thin slice. However, compared to Schubert, my sister and I both prefer this little cake shop
author: Cheryn L.

description:
This father/daughter owned bakery is simply glorious.  I never knew I could have an emotional response to baked goods, but everything they make can make a grown man cry.  I felt like I never knew scones before eating them at Fillmore.  Not like those dry biscuits at Starbucks, these were moist, mixed with fresh fruit, and the best I'd ever had.  The ham and cheese croissant makes me feel like I'm in Paris.  And their "cheapest hipster coffee on Fillmore" is indeed that at a dollar and change, and it is delicious.  

In the dictionary next to the definition of "beloved neighborhood bakery" should be a picture of this little gem.  Keep rockin' those delicious confections, Fillmore Bakeshop.
author: Jesse H.

description: UNICORN CAKE!!! Seriously amazing, we ordered a 10inch chocolate salted caramel cake, decorated unicorn style, WOOOOOW, it was sooo good.  Customer service was great, the cake was decorated amazingly, the cake tasted so good, can't wait for our next event, will definitely be ordering from Fillmore Bakeshop again!!!  I want to try all of the pastures in the shop too!!
author: Joy K.

description:
Cute bakery with a large variety of desserts! The colorful macarons caught my eye. They are $2 each and slightly larger than your regular macarons. I tried the green tea and it was good. The outside texture is very crispy and the flavor was light. 

The people that worked here were so nice. They told me the cronuts ($3) are what they are known for which is a cross between a croissant and doughnut. The cronuts are definitely worth trying. It's super flaky and had this delicious cinnamon sugar coating around it.
author: Linda X.

description: It's still the best!  The quiches and bread pudding are "worth a journey," in the phrase of the old Michelin Guides.  In fact, the Fillmore Bakeshop raises bread pudding to a whole new level -- it's lighter than other versions, and contains fresh fruit.  Heaven!  The place has the vibe of bakeries in France or Switzerland.  Great service, too!
author: Henry M.

description:
Out of all the bakeries in San Francisco, I am very surprised Fillmore Bakeshop has nominal amount of reviews and little love. Even some of the newer bakeries have more reviews than the corner bakery in Pacific Heights. 

But this is one of the few that bake and offer the renowned Cro-nut, a pastry I have yet to try. For $2.75, I get a round doughnut shape pastry with a flakiness and crunchiness of a croissant and cinnamon and sugar topping. There are not too many bakeries in San Francisco that offer the exclusive pastry. I am happy I got my first taste of the "Cro-Nut". Hopefully it won't be my last. My treat: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fillmore-bakeshop-san-francisco?userid=HYQoxBC1y1DGPq6pGP09Tw#PULY143gksR30BN2kN_KwQ

I also found out from Facebook, the bakery also offer special flavored cro-nuts on Saturdays with a limited amount baked. I may need wake up early to try the other flavored cro-nuts and other pastries from this popular bakery.
author: Matt G.

description: Their coffee is really good.  And I'm particular about such things.  I've only been there once.  I had a nice employee helping me, but I also spotted a surly one.  Cheese danish was really good too.
author: Stan H.

description:
Okay, okay, okay. 

My cousins were right.  My sisters were right.  Yelp was right.  

This is definitely a place to stop by for fatty goodness when you're in the Bay.  Make sure you get there early.  Street parking is 50/50. 

Cronuts are almost $3 each.  Well worth it.  

Overall, just get one of everything...  =)
author: Kristin H.

description:
Four stars for the blackberry macaron and orange macaron we tried today. Walked by during the Fillmore Festival today and realized I had this bakery on my bookmark list to try their "cronuts". Walked in and there were not a lot of items other than cookies left. We got these two huge macarons for $1.75 or something each. We both loved the flavor and texture; not overly sweet, soft and chewy inside and not too crumbly outside. The filling were also perfect both in portion and creaminess. 

Was told them they make about 300 cronuts a day and they are usually sold out by 11 am. So best time is probably right around 9 am when they are open. Soooo, maybe next time!
author: Claire W.

description:
I placed an order here for my mother's birthday.  I ordered an assortment of their macaroons, I told them that we wanted one of every kind, and I placed my order over a month in advance.  The macaroons were smaller than what I thought they would be, but delicious.  The assortment we got only had 4 flavors, YELP photos seem to list endless flavors, so I was bummed about that.  But the flavors were all fresh and delicious.  

I paired that with a slice of princess cake, very almondy, but a favorite amongst everyone.  20 macaroons, and a slice of cake, $43.  Solid bakery.
author: Kim K.

description:
I tried the cinnamon sugar cronut, the cronut special and the morning bun. I liked the flavor of the cronut and it was better than others I've had but doesn't compare to one I had in Sacramento at estelles pastisserie. 

My favorite of the three was the morning bun. The bread pudding looked awesome and hope to try that soon!
author: Daniela J.

description: It's been a long time since I've visited such a robust, privately owned bakeshop as Fillmore Bakeshop. I walked in here one morning and was amazed at the variety they had to offer! Everything looked delicious- I settled on a veggie croissant since I was in the mood for something savory. It did not disappoint! The employees were very friendly, and I know for sure I will be back to try more. This establishment is amazing and is a true neighborhood gem!
author: Monica M.

description: love the selections for pound cake and the bakes. Altho i wish they have more cakes today but anyway I got what i need so nothing to complain. :) Leave happily. Gonna come back to try their salt caramel bites.
author: Kei S.

description:
Holy Croquenbouche! Fillmore Bakeshop are amazing and Elena is incredible. 
We used them for our April 2017 wedding and we were not disappointed. 
I wanted to find a place that would make the traditional french celebration desert Croquenbouche the right way - using Crème Anglaise and real rum - and Fillmore Bakeshop was the only place that delivered!
Elena is funny and on-point with what we wanted. The cake was simply beautiful and elegant and never have I tasted something so delicious!
I can't wait to have more things to celebrate so I have an excuse to re-order from Fillmore Bakeshop.
author: Raphaelle C.

description: The best oatmeal raisin cookies! I seem to always crave their cookies around the holidays. I'm also a big fan of the latest goat cheese and tomato tarts! It's light and so flavorful.
author: Wendy L.

description:
First off, I have to say that I LOVE their window artwork. There is absolutely no way for my eyes to avoid it.
Now to the pastry... I am speechless. They're ALL so detailed and delicious (I know, I lack better words). No matter if it's details in the taste or the decorations, they all satisfy your crave for something bright and tasty. Actually, not exactly. They don't satisfy your crave, because whenever you finish (it can be anything from them), you merely crave for another. That's what I literally experienced, and that's exactly how satisfying their food is. And let's not forget how kind they are to each customer. They're always smiling and welcoming, which gives off a really warm aroma. Can't love it more here!
author: Opal D.

description: Great variety and yummy pastries! Also good coffee! Good luck finding a place to park though!
author: Auriyon J.

description:
The Cronut is very good. Crisp outside, the cinnamon sugar just perfect not too sweet.

I love latte here more than S*** Bucks. Their milk foam is super soft. 

And the place is so cute, it's a good place to chill out your cold morning here.
author: Thancha N.

description: Great pastries and Friendly staff.  Best coffee deal in neighborhood. Love their scones and morning buns.
author: Teresa O.

description:
We have our "yearly tradition" (about 10 years I think) of having one or two breakfasts or lunches at this bakery while visiting my parents who lived in Japantown SF.  Since they passed away few years ago we could've stay in other part of SF where my brother lives, but still can't resist ourselves in a pleasure of staying for couple of days nearby this bakery and enjoying their wonderful baked products again and again before moving to the area where my brother lives. The owners are the nicest people ever, recognize us every time we come and their warm attitude towards their clientele leave the same lasting and pleasurable impression on us as their pastries and pies do. So we always leave this place in a best mood and satisfaction. We wish and hope this tradition would last as long as possible, and our only regret is that they are on the West cost and we are on the East one. But that speaks a volume about how wonderful this bakery is. 
So if you are that lucky to live nearby, ENJOY eating here often, and just know that we envy you...
A LOT!!!!!!!!!
author: Tatyana M.

description:
My first visit here was a couple of months a go. I just happened to walk in while a batch of cinnamon sugar Cronuts were still cooling on its metal pan on the back counter (it was around 9ish on a weekday) ordered one and a couple of macaroons togo. Paid the nice cashier and walked to my car that was a short block away. Before I got to my car I had finished my Cronut! Cinnamon sugar all over my clothes and hands. It was so good I forgot how to eat like a lady.
Today I was in the area in the late afternoon (no Cronuts to be seen) stopped in and purchased some macaroons. All the baked goods looked pretty and plentiful. Cashier was really friendly and greeted me as I walked in. Macaroon was just as I remember slight crunch of its outer shell, soft inside and not too sweet. Just the way I like em $1.95 ea

Overall worth the drive!!! I'll be back.
author: Liz N.

description:
I stayed up in San Francisco for the weekend and Fillmore Bakeshop was literally just walking distance from where I was staying.  I could not imagine actually living here because I would probably be at Fillmore Bakeshop everyday!  Such a cute little (I think family run) bakery with a variety of macarons, cakes, cookies, pastries, and did I mention cronuts?

The line wasn't too long at around 10AM so my friends and I decided to wait.   Fillmore Bakeshop calls their cronuts "D's Nutz" and the flavor of the day was coffee crunch.  I had a so-so first time cronut experience in San Diego so I was excited to try theirs.  I almost thought that I wasn't going to get a chance to try the coffee crunch since every few minutes while we were standing in line they would announce that they only had X number of cronuts left!  The coffee crunch cronut was delicious.  fresh, flakey, and just the right amount of glaze to satisfy your sweet tooth.  

Wish that they had another register to speed up the line and I tried to bring home to San Diego a cronut or other treats for my fiance but they are closed on Mondays so I was bummed!  I guess i'll just have to come back.  =(
author: Christine D.

description: Wanted to buy macaroons, but they said they don't sale them! There drawing on the window. Pictures on there web site!  So we left! This should get a star!
author: Marie W.

description:
This doughnut/croissant hybrid sounds like an absolute dream and since May, I've been dying to sample this international hype generating pastry myself. (I say "international" because a bakery in London now offers these.) And just the other day I was finally able to experience them by way of Fillmore Bakeshop. Although, I initially was not interested in tasting anything other than the original, I figured I would never wake up at the buttcrack of dawn while on one of my NYC trips to stand in such a long line at Dominque Ansel's for just a chance to get one. So I "settled" for one of these "tribute" versions and wow was it fantastic!

Yesterday morning at about 8:15 (this is early for us for a Saturday morning), we queue'd in the frigid, drizzly, gusty morning with passer by-ers throwing confused glances our way. Some time later, we finally had a box of half a dozen cronuts in our hot little hands - 4 cinnamon and 2 lemon custard. 

As soon as we got back into the car we dove right into the box and took a bite out of the most delectable pastry I've probably ever had in my life. Buttery with flaky innards like any great croissant would have and deep fried to an ideal golden exterior. The lemon custard was not too tart which i liked. 

It was probably more a croissant than a doughnut as the only doughnut-like aspect that it had was its shape and that it is deep fried. But I think I prefer it this way. I hear the original is more dense and more doughnutty. 

Despite the huge spike of customers that are pouring in all the employees remained in good spirits and the owner really seemed to have a good sense of humor. While in line I had a chance to see the other baked goods they offered and they also looked great. Perhaps I'll have to pick up something else here besides the cronut but I'm hoping they'll be a permanent fixture behind their glass counters. 

Next week's flavor: salted caramel. Ugh, I guess I'm gonna have to set the alarm again...
author: Esther A.

description:
I came here on a Saturday morning around 9am to get some cronuts - best part was that there was no line!! Not sure if this is typical of a Saturday morning, so we might have gotten lucky! Having actually waited hours before for the original cronuts at Dominique Ansel, this was definitely a pleasant surprise.

We were informed that there were only plain cronuts that day, which was fine by us, and we bought 7 cronuts in total, 3 of which we devoured on the spot. The cronut itself was warm, flaky, and perfectly balanced in terms of sweetness. It's also not too big, so I would definitely recommend getting 2 per person.

 I actually much more prefer this cronut over the ones in New York, because custard fillings can get overly rich and messy. The plain cronut was extremely satisfying, and I will definitely be back for more.
author: Yuan J.

description:
Initially, I was ecstatic to try Fillmore Bakeshop's macarons. But, with so many other bakeries in the city that sell macarons (Chantal Guillon, Tout Sweet Patisserie, and multiple La Boulanges) why make the effort to go all the way to Pacific Heights? Then, I heard that they made cronuts. Although I never tried cronuts from the originating bakery, Dominique Ansel Bakery in New York, I was pleasantly surprised and really enjoyed the ones from Fillmore Bakeshop.

The day I visited, two flavors of cronuts were available: cinnamon sugar and peaches & cream. Both were delicious, with fluffy and soft layers in the center and a crispy outer shell. I preferred the cinnamon sugar though, mainly because it was simpler and not as sweet. Also, the peaches & cream flavor was just a plain cronut with peach-flavored custard piped into the center hole, making it messy to eat when you reach the center. But nevertheless, Fillmore Bakeshop is one of the very few bakeries in SF that offer these ever-so desirable, high-calorie-filled, tasty pastries. I wonder what unusual, crazy hybrid of pastries bakeries will conjure up next.

On the other hand, I wasn't as impressed with the macarons. The outer shells were too crispy, so they crumbled easily and were an absolute mess to eat. I was unimpressed with the mocha and lavender flavors, but did enjoy the pineapple rum and strawberry ones. Although decent in taste, presentation was sub par. The almond meal isn't fine enough, so the cookies are a little bumpy and lopsided. But for price to portion ratio, Fillmore Bakeshop probably has one of the best deals in the city at $1.95 per macaron, yet not at the best quality.

The interior is very bright, clean, and simple. I love the open kitchen, being able to watch the bakers prepare all the cakes, pastries, and cookies. The window decor is cute. However, there are only a couple of tables inside. Better take your pastries to-go and devour them elsewhere (especially those cronuts, as they're best fresh).
author: Priscilla W.

description:
Note: They do not make Cronuts anymore.
Very sad...
author: Tee D.

description: Delicious!! Savory and sweet! The pretzel with the ham and cheese was off the hook! And the cinnamon buns and croissants! Delicious lattes, too!
author: Shawnna M.

description:
The first (& second!) time we went here was by accident but, I don't think it could of worked out better. The food was simply amazing. I got the morning bun the first day it was the most delicious thing on the planet. The second time I chose the apple Danish and it was the best one I've ever had. 
     Huge thumbs up to the atmosphere. It was super great. It seemed like everyone was happy and the food was so fresh. Fillmore bakeshop is the most picture perfect little bakeshop adorably tucked into the corner. All in all,the next time I'm in San Francisco you'll be able in find me there.
author: Kelly K.

description: Used to come here for cronuts but the last time the clerk told me they didn't make them anymore because the fryer broke and cronuts weren't popular anymore. !!#  had a Danish which was ok but the special.part of this place was cronuts. Will probably spend my bakery dollar in a place with cronuts (cinnamon ones)
author: Lamb C.

description:
This review is for the large variety of pastries that this bakeshop had while I was in there one Saturday morning....

I walked in on a Saturday morning at 8am since I live half a block away, and I was surprised at how many pastries they had. They had pastries such as butter croissants, apple turnovers, ham and cheese buns, apricot Danishes, a whole display case of macarons, and so much more! 

I was bummed because I came in for the cronuts, it would be my first time trying them. I was there as soon as they opened because I read reviews the previous night about how lines form outside for the delicious cronuts, so I came in hoping to try some. Unfortunately the nice lady cashier told me they wouldn't be ready for another hour. So I just chose other pastries instead and left. I'll come back another Saturday and try the cronuts that so many yelpers rave about, I look forward to it! 

Besides the cronut dilemma, this bakeshop has many wonderful and delicious looking parties to choose from, and the lady cashiers are very friendly and give great customer service. Definitely check this place out! :)
author: Amanda R.

description:
Delicious pastries and coffee, great atmosphere for an afternoon or morning treat. 

They offer soy milk and many cookies and such are gluten free.

The princess cake and mocha meringue were delicious.
author: Antoinette C.

description: Their French King cake for Epiphany was amazing. The crust was expertly done. So flaky. Really perfect. We'll definitely be back. Can't wait to taste their other pies.
author: s r.

description: A blueberry cheese danish and a vanilla latte make for a good morning in San Francisco. I stay in Japantown when I visit SF and I seemingly always stop in for coffee and a pastry at this bake shop every time. The pastries are super fresh and delicious- I might roll out of bed to get some of that apple pie right now.
author: River H.

description:
I live around the corner from FB and I stop in at least once a week for a sweet treat. 

Poppyseed Danish
Pretzel Croissant 
All the fruit pies 
Crunch cookie
They have super cute macaroons - so much better than the standard size and shape 

The cakes are fantastic. As are the chocolate covered apricots & princess cake. Pretty much everything is delicious! They also whip up a great cappuccino too!

Fillmore Bakeshop is the best!
author: Shanna N.

description:
New great pastry at the Fillmore Bake Shop!
Another yummy Doug's creation. 
A delicious croissant filled with orange flavored custard and covered with abundant almond slivers and powder sugar. A must try!
author: Antonella O.

description:
I love doughnuts. I love croissants. I love bakeries. I love sweets. This place put them all together so well! Went here after brunch with a friend (we'd already consumed a biscuit, coffee cake and a brioche muffin with jam) but I was ready for more. Went with the two cronuts of the day: cinnamon sugar and mocha. Also got their almond croissant.

The cronuts were just as good as you'd want them to be. Granted, I haven't had the real thing before, but I've tried a few of the imitators. These hit the mark all the way. Crispy and flaky and buttery like a croissant, but fried and flavorful like a doughnut. Not too sweet, not doughy...all in all a success. 

The almond croissant was good but didn't bowl me over. I'd like to come back and try more of their goodies!
author: David B.

description:
Went at 9am on a Friday and got a dozen Cronuts. There was no line, so definitely recommend hitting it up on a weekday to avoid the Sat AM line.

Also, love the wonderful father/daughter duo who runs the shop. They are both so funny and totally know how badass their baking is.

The cronuts here are as good as they get. They're served warm, crispy and flaky. Not too sweet and not too greasy. Plus they last for at last 2 days so get a bunch and let them keep giving :). The pretzel was fresh & delicious as well!
author: Neeharika B.

description: This place is amazing! With an assortment of fun and classical pastries, cakes, cookies and breads, it seems to be a destination for locals and visitors. I've samples many items and go there when I am in town for coffee and espresso. They have both savory and sweet items.  You can get it to go or sit at one of the tables. They do a brisk and friendly business.
author: Anne B.

description: We had cronuts, they were very alright, we got them in the afternoon and they tasty like they'd been re-heated and plunged twice in the oil... so it was hard from outside and sugar and oil with mixed in my mouth.. bad taste sorry :/
author: Rachida I.

description:
No, I haven't tried one of their cronuts.  I just can't get here that early from where I live *sad face*.  However, I did try their quiche lorraine, their cherry pie and a few of their macaroons.  These guys are exceptional bakers.  In the few minutes I was here to enjoy my quiche, I saw item after item disappear from their display and the staff continually making new baked items and putting them out fresh.  The cashier was an absolute gentleman to everyone that came in.  Their cakes looked amazing, their pastries looked buttery and flaky, and the whole place smelled sweet and wonderful.  Ahhh, how I love bakeries.  

One day I'll come early for one of those cronuts, but you can't really go wrong with anything here.  All fresh, all from scratch, all delicious. And service with a smile - what more could you ask for.  I know, more cronuts during the day.
author: Maria S.

description:
We wanted a croquembouche for our wedding, so we contacted Fillmore Bakeshop after extensive research. Not too many places in the city make it and we were incredibly lucky to find one that do and able to deliver to Marin on our wedding day. 

Ordering here was easy. When we first contacted them online/phone, Elena told us to come in to their shop, and on the day that we scheduled, she was out of the shop, but left samples of the croquembouche for us to try. After that, it was mostly emails to let her know what I like, the color scheme, etc so that she can decorate it. I also sent them a few photos of what I like from Pinterest as a sample, and they were able to do one very similar to a photo I sent them. Paying was easy. I was able to pay whenever I was in the area. So I just went to the shop shortly after we decided on everything to pay and that was it. The only other time I sent her an email was to confirm maybe a week before the wedding to make sure all was ready to go. The croquembouche looked so lovely and fit in seamlessly with the venue/decor. We love the croquembouche and our guests thought it was awesome too. Thank you so very much! 

I also want to mention that I love their pastries and when we are nearby this bakery, we always make it a point to visit.
author: Lisa X.

description:
Upon entering into this sweet shop, I was glistening with happiness from looking at all the variety of macaroons!  Each flavor was piled up high and I wanted to take one of each home with me.  But at a $1.95 each, I had the hard choice of selecting a few to 'get into my belly'.   The 4 that I picked out did not disappoint!

- lemon - zingy
- chocolate - my fav since I'm a serious chocoholic
- root beer - tasted just like the real deal :)
- orange - yumzzzzz

These tasty morsels of heaven were perfect!  And they were HUMONGOUS ...well, at least compared to all the other macaroons I've bought from other reputable bakeries in the city.

Bottom line, I'm in love with this shop.  I wish it wasn't so far from me!  But We'll meet again next year when Fillmore Festival event is upon us again...
author: Jenny T.

description: Never know such a great bakery existed and so close to work!! Staff is super friendly. I ordered a birthday cake for my sister and they were able to make it her favorite color!! Cannot wait to show her the cake. Oh, also found out that their cronuts sell out early :-( so I will be back early just for those!
author: Lan V.

description: This is a GREAT bakery! Service is always pleasant. They make a large selection of cookies, bars and pies. What prompted me to write a review today was the blueberry and blackberry scone I had this morning.  It was the best scone I've ever had! You have to try it to understand
author: Martha L.

description: I showed up earlier this week, hoping to pick up a pie - they only had one option, which was really disappointing because it's the week of thanksgiving. You would think they would have more available, especially since they weren't taking orders anymore. I ordered a sugar cookie bar to go and it was 100% stale. It could be circumstantial - but I was pretty disappointed in my experience here.
author: Kayla S.

description: This bakery is the best kept secret in SF. Everyone goes on an on about B Patisserie right down the street (which I agree is superb), but Fillmore Bakeshop is just as good maybe even better. It's a family run shop with a great selection of pastries and desserts. My favorites include the blueberry cream cheese danish and the bear claw. For thanksgiving my family ordered their apple and pumpkin pies and wow...simply incredible. They were a huge hit for the holiday. I unfortunately, have to walk by here every day on the way to work and smell the freshly baked pastries through the open door and windows. Wish I could pick one up every day! Amazing spot! Anxious to try more of their desserts.
author: Alyssa C.

description:
If I had abs, they would've definitely been left in SF RIGHT HERE. And you know what? No regrets. My relationship with Filmore is that of certain kind of love story. 

Ever since I read about the cronut, my mouth has been perpetually drooling over it. In LA, I had one but it was a little more on the doughnut side. 

Filmore has the CRONUT DOWN. Colin and I ate 8 within 30 hours... And loved them so much we took a special uber trip to grab some to take home. 

Every bite was perfectly flaky and balanced the doughnut to croissant ratio perfectly. 

Hands down, the best food experience I had in SF!
author: Sarah M.

description:
The bakeshop is one of my favorite places to go on my lunch breaks! They have some of the most delicious, fresh baked pastries I've ever had! But my absolute go-to favorites are the morning bun and the crunch cookie! And they always have a good stock of choices; one of my biggest pet peeves is going to a bake shop and them having virtually nothing left after the morning rushes. Their coffee is also very good and always tastes fresh; they don't leave stale, old coffee in their pots ever. The customer service is exceptional and I'm always happy to talk and order from the sweet ladies behind the counter :) 

Definitely a 5-Star, class act type of place that is very well taken care of by the employees and the owners. Especially when they're trying to protect the safety of your child by not letting him/her enter a work area with the dangerous tools they use to make their products. So no, they don't have a public restroom but it's for your safety.
author: Belle M.

description:
I'd heard a ton about their version of the Cronut Croissant/Donut...

I've never had the original from NYC, so I don't have anything to compare it to, but I thought it was a great pastry!  Fluffy, buttery, layered with a slightly crisp outer layer.  It was sweet, but not too sweet.

They usually have two versions available - the plain/original and one with a unique topping (I tried Mocha).

Definitely worth the visit!
author: Ken G.

description:
I now have been frequenting Fillmore Bakeshop for over 3 years. It has become my Number 1 pastry shop. I have tried the hip and trending and award-nominated others and keep coming back here. It is my definition of a Bakery; pastries, cookies, cakes, etc... And the chocolates and coffee are additional yummies. It is a BAKE shop not a fry shop so, although I too enjoyed a cronut or old-fashioned donut once in a while, I understood when they decided not to replace the old fryer when it broke. It is certainly not a reason not to frequent this place as they have more than enough delicious caloric edibles to make you happy!! They take great pride in their pastries and candies and cakes and every day there is something new and fresh. I love the way the owners/bakers experiment and try new goodies (can you say crispy twist full of ham and cheese or hotdog in phyllo?!)
Holidays are extra special with hand-poured chocolates and traditional European holiday treats. 
There are busy days when it's pretty much choose, pay and wave goodbye and there are calmer days when the workers are able to chat a minute. Again, I don't hold it against anyone when they need to focus on their work. They are baking and creating the entire time you are licking your lips and trying to decide what you "need" to eat. I have always gotten smiles and prompt friendly service. 
As for coffee with crema art, give me a break hipster, go to the home of cappuccino (Italy) and see if they give you crema art!! Really?? 
If you want consistently fresh delicious baked goods and many options to choose from, Fillmore Bakeshop is your bakery. I'll see you there!!
author: Laura M.

description:
A co-worker brought in some cronuts for us.  I tried getting into this store during the Fillmore Jazz Festival and it was too long for me to wait for one of their treats. 
The cronuts we ate at work were very good, the dough was layered and flaky and it was shaped like a donut.  Must've been 1000 calories.  We all thought it was a bit too oily. I had 2-3 layers of paper towels and the oil still soaked thru onto the paper folder on my desk.
I think it was sweet enough but they added sprinkles of sugar around the cronut which made it too sweet for my liking.  I would prefer one of their plain croissants but if you have a sweet tooth, the cronut might be your thing.
author: Ry T.

description: Fell in love with their peanut butter and jelly macarons! I've tried to find some where I live, but no other macaron compares!
author: Rachel S.

description: Skip the cookies, the coffee is okay, but the quiche and pastries are bomb. Haven't tried yet, but the cakes look amazing too.
author: Samantha S.

description: What a great find as I was strolling down Fillmore St - full of fun shops and eateries. This is a charming flash from the past! Homey bakery with delicious assortment of cookies, macaroni, chocolates (even Florentines), croissants, and the most delicious pies. It's not often you find home baked cherry pies made with fresh cherries! Could not resist and ordered a slice with coffee. It was outstanding! A very homey casual place with a few tables. Service is also very friendly!
author: Eileen W.

description: The Fillmore Bakeshop is the perfect city bakery. I recently moved out of the neighborhood, and I very much miss this cafe. I loved stopping in for a latte and pastry on Saturday afternoons, and I also occasionally ordered desserts from them to take to dinners at friends' houses. The bakeshop's cookies, pies, and scones are all wonderful. I never had anything there I didn't love, but my favorites are the butterscotch cream pie, the hazelnut ring, and the Sarah Bernhardt. They only have four tables, so just be aware that if it's busy, you might not be able to sit and hang out. Also be aware that on Sunday  they close a bit early (4 pm).
author: Eva G.

description: My Mom ordered a birthday cake for my sister and I. It was one of the best cakes I've ever had and I usually don't like cake. It was the ebony and ivory. Delicious!!
author: Raquel V.

description:
I got a selection of pastries including kronuts, danishes, bead pudding, etc for my coworkers. The pastries went over really well. In fact someone had gotten donuts from Dynamo Donuts that day as well, and I had some people confide in me that the Fillmore Bakeshop Kronut was tastier than the Dynamo Donuts donut. Totally didn't mean to compete, but glad to win :-)

I had to try a piece of the bread pudding and I agree, SO TASTY!
author: Nader A.

description:
This is such a cute bakery on a corner of Fillmore Street. I loved the painted desserts in the window and the chalkboard sign reading "HOT CROSS BUNS!" perched outside the door.  The employee that greeted me and rang me up was so cheery. On the first day of sunshine after a week of rain, it only added to my happiness this morning.

Yep, we're still on the hunt for the best chocolate chip cookie in the bay.  I couldn't find a plain CCC (chocolate chip cookie) here, only a double CCC or a CCC with pecans. I opted for the one with pecan, and it only set me back $1.50. The cookie is thin and has a ton of mini chocolate chips. The chip to batter ratio is at least 1:1. The cookie was pretty good, but not the best we've tried. Even though it was thin it still retained some chewiness. 

I also impulsively bought a salted caramel macaron, even though I thought they looked too large and lumpy. $3.45 later, I was out the door with two treats.The salted caramel macaron is slightly misleading because it is lightly drizzled with dark chocolate and the filling has both dark chocolate and salted caramel.  I let boyfriend eat half and he LOVED it. I thought the flavor was great, although I wish the filling was all caramel and no chocolate. It was still crumbly upon first bite and slightly chewy in the middle. I still think they need work, but I'd try the other flavors if I was in the neighborhood again. They are better than Miette's, for sure.
author: Jenn C.

description:
My favorite macarons in the area! Not sure how macarons are traditionally supposed to be, but I really like how the exterior of the macarons here are so crisp that it practically shatters when you first bite into it. The interior is pleasantly soft and airy with a slight chew. When I went in, they had five flavors, out of which I tried coconut, pb&j, blackberry, and salted caramel. I liked them all, and would get any of them again!

The macarons are bigger than others I've had in the area. I think they were 2.10 each! There were a lot of other pastries too, all of which looked really good, so I'll have to try those too.
author: Abby S.

description:
CRONUTS!!

I thought I would never have the chance to try a cronut unless I traveled to NYC but you can get them right here on Fillmore Street! I convinced my friends to stop here after brunch because they only sell the cronuts on Saturday and I wanted to buy one before they sold out. They had such a beautiful array of pastries on display that i wanted to try all of them, especially the raspberry danish, but I stuck with the cronut. I went with the cinnamon sugar (they also had caramel chocolate) and I wasn't disappointed. 

The layers of the cronut were buttery, soft goodness and the outside was covered in delicious cinnamon sugar. I gave my boyfriend a few bites but I was happy that I had most of it to myself =) Definitely won't be eating this on a regular basis but I'm so pleased I was able to try it and didn't have to wait in an insanely long line to do so.
author: Sam F.

description: The BEST Chocolate Chip Pecan Cookies...Hands.DOWN! I try my best to stop by at least once a week, and if they're running low, I take whatever's left; that's how GREAT they are!
author: Mark A.

description:
Holy cow. Just like homemade pie, except waaay better than a lot of homemade pie. Including mine, sigh. And mine's pretty dang good. 

This review is for a whole peach pie I purchased. I'm a bit of a pie snob, and really rarely like pie that's not homemade, but I've been known to make exceptions for verrry good pie (like that served at our wedding!). However, no time to make a pie left me schlepping to the nearest bakery. Thank God it was Fillmore! The pie was expensive ($30), and I kinda wish they'd told me about the $10 refundable pie-pan deposit policy when I called on the phone (only because I leave the city soon), but that's really no problem. Also the pie was TOTALLY WORTH $30, and I'm a cheapskate. Ultra fresh peaches and really on-point crust. Highly recommended! Would've taken a photo but it was gone way too fast.
author: Mary D.

description: I don't give out 5 stars easily, but Fillmore Bakeshop earns every one! We already had it good in Pac Heights with the renewed presence of La Boulangerie, but with Fillmore Bakeshop, it's just over the top! This place is just delightful: You walk in, and are welcomed with an overwhelming array of fresh baked goodies! It's hard to choose just one (and in fact, lately I've been choosing TWO, since I can't make my mind up most times)! And they're super friendly, too. Can't go wrong. This place is happily part of my daily routine now.
author: Eric H.

description: This place was a bright spot in our day. Friendly counter person. Beautiful tasty treats. The ham and cheese croissant was a perfect lite breakfast. A nice selection of baked goods. Highly recommend.
author: Sally R.

description:
Cronuts!!! 

I don't do cronuts, but I know my gf does.  So, here's my plan.  We're going to go here for breakfast and I will order something else. I will get what I want and then get to snack off her cronuts.  Knock two birds with one stone, I say. 

The cronuts or D's Nutz is what peeps line up for here at Fillmore Bakeshop.  We came one morning and they told us the cronuts are served at 9 AM.  Because we were only a few blocks away, we had no problem leaving and coming back. Of course, my gf got the cronuts and I sampled it.  You go through multiple experiences when you eat one of these.  First you get through the outer layer donut side of the force.  Sweet, crunchy, and tasty with a hint of cinnamon.  Then you get to the croissant side of the force, which is my favorite part.  The layers of the croissant expresses a light, moist, and tasty pastry that compliments the donut really well.  Yes...this was good and I was very tempted to get one for myself but I didn't since I already had their Almond Croissant (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=ul_a_LsnOLmbeGE1v1vVDQ&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQ), Irish Coffee Macaron (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=CiuIKwdk72fbQQtXT6wefw&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQ), and a Pecan Butter Cookie (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=fpAHQUHoS_Bo9lxY2eNpzA&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQ).  I didn't want to go overboard my first time here.  The taste of all three of my pastries was well worth it. I would have to say that the pecan butter cookie was the best of the three, but my gf's cronuts tops them all.  

PS:  I also tried their ham & cheese croissant on another day (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=fm8MOMugK7xUVdY0op502Q&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQ).  This was pretty good too, but thought it was a little small for what I paid.  

TIP:  Line for their cronuts start before 9 AM.  So, come early.  


YELP PERSONAL CHALLENGE 2013 - (455/500)
author: Mel C.

description:
Sometimes you need a little bit of party hardy, some happy juice in your life. Shots, shots, shots, err'body! 

But I draw the line at mixing alcohol and cake! 

Made the rookie mistake today of ordering a cake and forgetting to ask for a virgin chocolate hazelnut cake. Took a bite and was like drats, no bueno. 

However, their virgin chocolate hazelnut is great for chocolate lovers everywhere. You want to savor the taste and yet gobble it as fast as you can. 

Just gotta remember next time to specify chocolate hazelnut cake, virgin, please! 

PS - For pastry lovers out there, you'll definitely be one happy camper after eating any of their bad boys! Tis quite the bite of ecstasy especially if you're able to get one of their cronuts fresh out of the fryer! Love me some cinnamon sugar goodness!
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Yup, cronut mania. Apparently some people showed up at 7:30AM to wait in line. Not necessary! They start selling them at 9AM on Saturdays (and only on Saturdays), I showed up at 9:05, and got them by 9:55. I sat down, ate them, and by the time I left, they were still selling them, even though they "officially" stop at 10AM. So, yeah, no need to show up too early, at least as of today. Maybe the word hasn't spread around too much yet. Oh, and they're now called D's Nutz (in honor of Dominique Ansel), since they're not allowed to call them kronuts. Well played, guys.

And yes, the wait was definitely worth it. Airy and crispy, like a fried croissant in the shape of a doughnut. I was a little disappointed I wasn't going to get to try one of the custard ones, but the salted caramel and chocolate one was amazeballs - perfect combination of sweet and salty, not too sweet and a little salty. They have cinnamon and sugar every week, and the other one changes.

Also tried their macarons, which are thicker and more doughy than I'm used to. Still tasty, though. For the best macarons, go to Chantal Guillon.
author: Angel C.

description:
After all this time, FIllmore Bakeshop continues to impress me, and I still get excited every time I enter its doors!

Focaccia on Saturdays now! Topped with tomatoes, artichoke, jalapenos and cheese, this savory treat is incredibly tasty with just the right about of kick.  It is great by itself, with soups, and even with eggs.  Definitely one of my new faves!

I'm not a macaron kind of guy (and I seem to be the odd man out in SF nowadays), but Elena makes a great macaron.  You can tell she has really been working on perfecting the recipe.  I tried the chocolate hazelnut and rose ones today, and they were both divine. The flavors were not overpowering.  Incredibly smooth, light and moist on the inside, and cookie perfection on the outside.
author: Gev M.

description: Stopped in before work and had a wonderful morning bun and cappuccino. The layers if the morning bun were full of cinnamon and dusted with sugar and was delighted by the pecans at the center! The cappuccino was delicious and I thought about ordering a 2nd one.   Wish I could start my morning here every day!
author: meg r.

description: One thing that I really don't care for is the thought of waiting in some enormous line or traveling many a mile to get one specific food item. The idea seems silly to me and the taste rarely if ever meets the hype. This palace of The Cronut has made me SERIOUSLY question my reasoning over the years. This sweet treat morsel meets and exceeds all the hype. When we are within a 30 min radius of Fillmore, it's an understood fact that my wife and I will traverse any plane and hour of the morning necessary to get my chubby little fingers on a Cronut. Hit it up fo sho.
author: Colin M.

description:
Okay, I'll start out by saying that I have only had the cronuts here.  And they are delicious.  Warm, buttery, sugary, cinnamony, flaky, delicious.  Definitely 5/5.  

The service here has also been amazing every time (4) that I have been there.  The staff is extremely friendly.  I'll give you an example.  One Sunday I came in to see if they would be making cronuts (usually they only have them on Saturday).  They happened to be making a batch that morning but they wouldn't be ready for an hour.  I said okay, I will come back!  Well time got away from me and I didn't come back for about an hour and a half.  Well, they had sold out of the entire batch, except the 2 they had saved for me!  I didn't ask them to save them for me.  They just did.  Awesome.
author: Paul W.

description:
CRONUT!  
This is the first cronut I've tried.  I don't know how the others compare, but this was pretty amazing.  Also more amazing that I didn't have to wait in line for this.  (Thank you friends for waiting in line for me!)
The outside was covered in sugar, and flaky like a croissant, but not excessively flaky.  Looking back in retrospect, I guess it could have been a little more flaky.  The inside was soft custard-like melt-in-your-mouth goodness.  I'd say this was maybe 25% croissant, and 75% doughnut. 

$2.75 each. Limit 4 per person.
author: Jeanne L.

description:
Came here on a Saturday morning to line up for the cronuts.  Surprisingly, the wait wasn't too bad.  

Limit is 4 per person so the bf and I ordered 8; 2 regular, 6 smores (flavor of the day).  It didn't make sense to order 8 between the two of us but since we dragged ourselves out of bed and waited in line for them, we might as well hit the max.  It was warm, soft, somewhat flaky.

It was good but not great.  Didn't really live up to the hype.  I was kind of disappointed after taking the 2nd bite and realized that I had bought 8.
author: Linda N.

description: Desserts are my down fall; so It was dangerous to let me loose I here! I tried a little bit of everything. Sad we don't have a bakery this good in Texas!
author: Denise P.

description: A cute, corner bakeshop with the delicious baked goods.  It's very friendly with a lot of hard working women bakers toiling away. The seeded croissant was outstanding. Had to buy two!  The spinach and mushroom quiche was delicious.  A very friendly place with outstanding pastries to boot!
author: Bee M.

description:
Awesome neighborhood bakery - just had the raspberry croissant that was recommended - amazing!!  Also couldn't resist a slice of the orange olive oil poppy seed cake for later :). 

My favorite part though was "eavesdropping" on the chef talking about some new combos she was trying out!  Love to hear the passion and excitement!  I will be back!
author: Margaret B.

description:
Everything in this shop looks so delicious!  We bought a variety of cookies and had to have a piece of the blueberry pie.  Soooooo yum! 

They make a variety of fresh pies and we could smell the oven's warm wafts of delicious baked goodness permeating the whole bakery.  The staff were super knowledgeable and friendly. If only we lived closer, it would be dangerously tempting to make a weekly stop!

We couldn't help notice the cute hello kitty cookies that people were coming in to buy and the huge almond croissants! Next time!
author: Carlyn C.

description: Very friendly neighborhood bakery and coffee shop. Their selection changes sometimes, to keep choices fresh. They make all kinds of delicious pies and you get your $$ back for the pie pan when you return it. I love their danish selection and the crust is make fresh right there where you can see the labor of layering in all that butter. Enjoy.
author: J. G.

description:
Disclaimer: My review is not about their baked goods. It's about the staff at Fillmore Bake Shop.

I have been to the store several times as I love their pastries. The down side of each visit is the staff. There has never been a single time when the staff greeted me happily. They see me entering and approaching the counter, one for the staff will walk up to the till and wait till I make my decision. None of the staff has ever smiled.  They are always appear cold and unfriendly. No doubt the ladies at Fillmore Bake Shop are great bakers. But, can they just smile a little when they are with their customers or is that too much to ask for? 

Again, this is just my observation and experience of the staff and this is not a review of their baked goods. I love their pastries and it is worth saying that again :)
author: L T.

description:
Ohhh yes. Hot Cross Bun season may be over right now, but man the seasonal desserts here just keep delivering. Just had an amazing apricot bread pudding and looking forward to them dropping lots of great stone fruit pies over the next few weeks.

Then there's the macaroons. What do you really say about these? Great, interesting flavors and really nice soft crunch.

The people here are also tops--usually have great recommendations and always up for a nice little conversation.

Their cookies may be a little overpriced, and I've had the Smores Bars fall apart in transport, but these are insanely minor things. This place is fantastic.
author: Paul C.

description:
Tied for my favorite cake place in the city with Susie Cakes!!

If I could have shipped my wedding cake 3,000 miles to Texas, I would have ordered from the Fillmore Bakeshop. Came in here for a Cake Tasting with my then-fiance and tried the Red velvet, Chocolate Mousse, Mango Passion Tart, and Chiffon. They were all amazing but the Chiffon and Mango Passion take the cake!

My friend Tom celebrated his 30th birthday recently and Ayesha had ordered three German Chocolate cakes from here and they were DIVINEEEEE.

Love love love the cakes. And, the owner was very nice and not pushy about ordering our cake from them. 

I've recommended this bakery to bride to be's and groom to be's who have all loved it as well.

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description: Came here with my daughter and Mom. I had a quiche Lorain and my daughter had a cronut. They were very good. Next time I come to SF. I will be back.
author: Rick L.

description:
The peppermint was by far my favorite macaroon :) (lemon,cherry, and Irish coffee were the other flavors)

Oatmeal raisin cookie & raisin spice cookie we awesome as well! 

The latte was good as well
author: Jeanette R.

description:
How to Cheer Up Your Better Half:

1) Go to Fillmore Bakeshop.

2) Pick up an assortment of pretty pastel macarons.

3) Surprise her with the fancy light blue box with silver lettering that she instantly recognizes.

4) "Help" her taste test the PBJ, packed with flavor passionfruit, blood orange, and sweet lemon macarons.

5) Mission Accomplished!
author: Amy C.

description:
Best macaroons I've EVER had! Apparently, they're the only place in the city that makes them by hand nowadays. That's a sad but good fact to know...
